access.英释: the right to enter a place, use something, see someone etc

theory.英释: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

signal.英释: to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

smooth.英释: a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch

plague.英释: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

unrest.英释: a political situation in which people protest or behave violently

import.英释: to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

praise.英释: to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

clumsy.英释: moving or doing things in a careless way, especially so that you drop things, knock into things etc

obtain.英释: to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

desert.英释: to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

aviate.英释: to pilot or fly in an aircraft

column.英释: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

hinder.英释: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

matter.英释: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

stress.英释: continuous feelings of worry about your work or personal life, that prevent you from relaxing

launch.英释: to start something, usually something big or important

remove.英释: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

engage.英释: If you engage in an activity, you do it or are actively involved with it.

mature.英释: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave

clinic.英释: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

expert.英释: having a special skill or special knowledge of a subject

solely.英释: not involving anything or anyone else

injure.英释: to hurt yourself or someone else, for example in an accident or an attack

appeal.英释: if someone or something appeals to you, they seem attractive and interesting

submit.英释: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

insist.英释: to demand that something should happen

detail.英释: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something

donate.英释: to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

govern.英释: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

device.英释: a machine or tool that does a special job

crisis.英释: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

enrich.英释: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

secure.英释: to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

arrest.英释: if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a  police station  because the police think they have done something illegal

afford.英释: to have enough money to buy or pay for something

enable.英释: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

narrow.英释: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

margin.英释: the empty space at the side of a page

legend.英释: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

enroll.英释: to officially arrange to join a school, university, or course, or to arrange for someone else to do this

rental.英释: the money that you pay to use a car, television, or other machine over a period of time

invade.英释: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

strain.英释: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard

vanish.英释: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

severe.英释: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

steady.英释: continuing or developing gradually or without stopping, and not likely to change

commit.英释: to do something wrong or illegal

assess.英释: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

expose.英释: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

esteem.英释: a feeling of respect for someone, or a good opinion of someone

survey.英释: a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

affirm.英释: to state publicly that something is true

degree.英释: the level or amount of something

lessen.英释: to become smaller in size, importance, or value, or make something do this

option.英释: a choice you can make in a particular situation

bureau.英释: a government department or a part of a government department in the US

budget.英释: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

agency.英释: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

burden.英释: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

absorb.英释: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

ensure.英释: to make certain that something will happen properly

gloomy.英释: making you feel that things will not improve

pledge.英释: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially

unique.英释: being the only one of its kind

rescue.英释: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm

render.英释: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

impose.英释: if someone in authority imposes a rule, punishment, tax etc, they force people to accept it

status.英释: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

intend.英释: If you intend to do something, you have decided or planned to do it.

spread.英释: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

gender.英释: the fact of being male or female

puzzle.英释: something that is difficult to understand or explain

critic.英释: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

assume.英释: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

demand.英释: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this

origin.英释: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

define.英释: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

tailor.英释: If you tailor something such as a plan or system to someone's needs, you make it suitable for a particular person or purpose by changing the details of it

remedy.英释: a medicine to cure an illness or pain that is not very serious

porter.英释: someone whose job is to carry people’s bags at railway stations, airports etc

strict.英释: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

reveal.英释: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

assign.英释: If you assign a piece of work to someone, you give them the work to do.

update.英释: to add the most recent information to something

bother.英释: to make the effort to do something

reject.英释: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

retain.英释: to keep something or continue to have something

convey.英释: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

prompt.英释: to make someone decide to do something

retail.英释: to be sold for a particular price in a shop

decent.英释: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

review.英释: to examine and describe the most important parts of a series of events or period of time

figure.英释: someone who is important or famous in some way

induce.英释: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

locate.英释: to be in a particular position or place

casual.中释: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
casual.英释: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

client.英释: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

garage.英释: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house

handle.英释: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

reward.英释: to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

worsen.英释: to become worse or make something worse

resign.英释: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

compel.英释: to force someone to do something

revise.英释: to change something because of new information or ideas

dampen.英释: to make something such as a feeling or activity less strong

pursue.英释: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

resist.英释: to try to prevent a change from happening, or prevent yourself from being forced to do something

source.英释: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

ignore.英释: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

switch.英释: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

couple.英释: two people who are married or having a sexual or romantic relationship

screen.英释: to do tests on a lot of people to find out whether they have a particular illness

divine.英释: coming from or relating to God or a god

insult.英释: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude

engine.英释: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make it move

emerge.英释: to appear or come out from somewhere

invest.英释: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

suffer.英释: to experience physical or mental pain

battle.英释: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

refine.英释: to improve a method, plan, system etc by gradually making slight changes to it

comply.英释: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

poison.英释: If someone poisons another person, they kill the person or make them ill by giving them poison

bakery.英释: a place where bread and cakes are baked, or a shop where they are sold

endure.英释: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

rocket.英释: if a price or amount rockets, it increases quickly and suddenly

divide.英释: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

derive.英释: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something

intake.英释: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

admire.英释: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

mutual.英释: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

evolve.英释: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

cancel.英释: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

advice.英释: an opinion you give someone about what they should do

makeup.英释: Makeup consists of things such as lipstick, eye shadow, and powder which some women put on their faces to make themselves look more attractive or which actors use to change or improve their appearance

namely.英释: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

effect.英释: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

devote.英释: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

detect.英释: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

reduce.英释: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

symbol.英释: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

planet.英释: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.

behave.英释: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc

hazard.英释: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

absent.英释: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go

refuel.英释: to fill a plane or vehicle with  fuel  before continuing a journey

tackle.英释: to try to deal with a difficult problem

expand.英释: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

weaken.英释: to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful

sticky.英释: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces

excess.英释: a larger amount of something than is allowed or needed

deepen.英释: if a serious situation deepens, it gets worse – used especially in news reports

impact.英释: the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

remote.中释: 遥远的； 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的； 遥控的
remote.英释: far from towns or other places where people live

salary.英释: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

kettle.英释: a container with a lid, a handle, and a spout,used for boiling and pouring water

devise.英释: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

temper.中释: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
temper.英释: to make something less severe or extreme

object.中释: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
object.英释: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

humble.中释: 谦逊的； 地位低下的； 简陋的
humble.英释: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

result.英释: something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

sexism.中释: 性别偏见， 性别歧视
sexism.英释: the belief that one sex is weaker, less intelligent, or less important than the other, especially when this results in someone being treated unfairly

policy.中释: 政策， 方针； 保险单
policy.英释: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

resume.中释: 摘要， 概要； 简历
resume.英释: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

sunset.英释: the time of day when the sun disappears and night begins

exceed.中释: 超过， 胜过， 超出
exceed.英释: to be more than a particular number or amount

export.中释: 输出， 出口； 输出品， 出口额
export.英释: the business of selling and sending goods to other countries

murder.英释: to kill someone deliberately and illegally

medium.英释: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc

wisdom.中释: 智慧， 才智； 名言
wisdom.英释: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

motive.英释: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden

mobile.中释: 运动的； 流动的； 多变的
mobile.英释: moving or able to move from one job, area, or social class to another

magnet.中释: 磁铁， 磁体； 有吸引力的人或事物
magnet.英释: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

cancer.英释: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

entire.英释: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

fierce.英释: done with a lot of energy and strong feelings, and sometimes violence

reform.中释: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
reform.英释: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

costly.英释: very expensive, especially wasting a lot of money

infect.中释: 传染， 感染； 影响

manner.中释: 方式； 态度； 风度； 礼貌， 规矩
manner.英释: the way in which something is done or happens

pigeon.英释: a grey bird with short legs that is common in cities

terror.中释: 恐怖， 惊骇； 引起恐怖的人或事

heroic.英释: extremely brave or determined, and admired by many people

muscle.中释: 肌肉， 体力； 力量， 实力
muscle.英释: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together

design.中释: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
design.英释: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

victim.英释: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

garlic.英释: a plant like a small onion, used in cooking to give a strong taste

accord.中释: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予
accord.英释: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment

stable.英释: a building where horses are kept

pillow.英释: a cloth bag filled with soft material that you put your head on when you are sleeping

sketch.英释: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail

supply.英释: an amount of something that is available to be used

liable.英释: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

offend.中释: 冒犯， 伤害…的感情； 使厌恶； 违反
offend.英释: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc

starve.英释: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat

marine.英释: A marine is a member of an armed force, for example the U.S. Marine Corps or the Royal Marines, who is specially trained for military duties at sea as well as on land.

anyway.中释: 无论如何， 至少； 不论以何种方式， 无论从什么角度
anyway.英释: used when adding something that corrects or slightly changes what you have just said

attack.英释: to start using guns, bombs etc against an enemy in a war

humour.中释: 幽默， 诙谐， 幽默感
humour.英释: the ability or tendency to think that things are funny, or funny things you say that show you have this ability

attach.中释: 缚， 系， 贴； 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
attach.英释: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

clause.中释: 条款； 从句， 分句
clause.英释: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

prayer.中释: 祷告， 祈祷； 祷文； 祈求， 祈望
prayer.英释: words that you say when praying to God or gods

purple.英释: a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue

polish.英释: a liquid, powder, or other substance that you rub into a surface to make it smooth and shiny

avenue.中释: 林荫道， 道路， 大街
avenue.英释: used in the names of streets in a town or city

campus.英释: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live

guilty.英释: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

pepper.英释: if something is peppered with things, it has a lot of those things in it or on it

plural.英释: a form of a word that shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘dogs’ is the plural of ‘dog’

effort.英释: the physical or mental energy that is needed to do something

weapon.英释: something that you use to fight with or attack someone with, such as a knife, bomb, or gun

grocer.英释: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells food and other things used in the home

center.中释: 圆心， 正中； 中心

genius.中释: 天才， 天赋， 天资； 天才人物
genius.英释: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

studio.中释: 画室， 摄影室； 播音室， 录音室， 摄影棚
studio.英释: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded

infant.英释: a baby or very young child

carbon.英释: a chemical substance that exists in a pure form as diamonds,  graphite  etc, or in an impure form as coal, petrol etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol C

unload.中释: 卸， 卸货； 下客； 退出子弹； 卸下胶卷
unload.英释: to remove the film from a camera

attain.中释: 达到， 获得， 完成
attain.英释: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

deputy.中释: 副职， 副手； 代表， 代理人
deputy.英释: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

warmth.中释: 暖和， 温暖； 热烈， 热情， 热心
warmth.英释: the heat something produces, or when you feel warm

junior.英释: a child who goes to a junior school

assure.中释: 使确信； 确保， 向…保证
assure.英释: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

merely.英释: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

wealth.中释: 财富， 财产； 丰富
wealth.英释: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

editor.中释: 编辑， 编者， 校订者
editor.英释: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

barrel.英释: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc

format.英释: to organize the space on a computer  disk  so that information can be stored on it

formal.英释: made or done officially or publicly

colony.中释: 殖民地； 侨居地， 聚居地； 群体， 集群
colony.英释: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

relief.中释: 轻松， 宽慰； 缓解； 调剂， 消遣； 接替
relief.英释: a feeling of comfort when something frightening, worrying, or painful has ended or has not happened

uneasy.中释: 心神不安的， 忧虑的
uneasy.英释: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

happen.中释: 发生； 碰巧， 恰好
happen.英释: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned

active.中释: 活跃的， 积极的； 主动的； 起作用的
active.英释: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

bucket.中释: 水桶， 吊桶； 铲斗
bucket.英释: an open container with a handle, used for carrying and holding things, especially liquids

shiver.英释: to shake slightly because you are cold or frightened

liquor.英释: a strong alcoholic drink such as whisky

unlike.英释: completely different from a particular person or thing

series.中释: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
series.英释: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

thrive.中释: 兴旺， 繁荣， 旺盛
thrive.英释: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

parcel.中释: 分， 分配； 把…包起来， 捆扎

static.英释: noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

vision.中释: 想象力； 梦幻； 视力， 视觉

petrol.英释: a liquid obtained from  petroleum  that is used to supply power to the engine of cars and other vehicles

reckon.中释: 认为， 估计； 指望， 盼望； 测算， 测量
reckon.英释: spoken to think or suppose something

bloody.英释: to injure someone so that blood comes, or to cover something with blood

poetry.英释: poems in general, or the art of writing them

vapour.英释: a mass of very small drops of a liquid which float in the air, for example because the liquid has been heated

priest.英释: someone who is specially trained to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Christian church

action.中释: 行动； 已做的事； 作用， 功能； 情节
action.英释: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

statue.中释: 塑像， 雕像， 铸像
statue.英释: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

vacant.中释: 空的， 未被占用的； 空缺的； 茫然的， 空虚的
vacant.英释: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

shield.英释: to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

notify.中释: 通知， 告知， 报告
notify.英释: to formally or officially tell someone about something

stream.英释: a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river

rotate.中释: 旋转， 转动； 轮流
rotate.英释: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

credit.中释: 相信； 把…记入贷方； 把…归于
credit.英释: to add money to a bank account

oxygen.英释: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

comedy.英释: entertainment that is intended to make people laugh

delete.英释: to remove something that has been written down or stored in a computer

fulfil.中释: 履行， 实现， 完成； 满足， 使满意
fulfil.英释: if you fulfil a hope, wish, or aim, you achieve the thing that you hoped for, wished for etc

wicked.中释: 坏的， 令人厌恶的； 淘气的， 顽皮的
wicked.英释: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

suburb.中释: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
suburb.英释: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

threat.中释: 威胁， 恐吓； 凶兆， 征兆
threat.英释: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

writer.英释: someone who writes books, stories etc, especially as a job

breast.中释: 乳房； 胸脯， 胸膛
breast.英释: one of the two round raised parts on a woman’s chest that produce milk when she has a baby

inform.英释: to officially tell someone about something or give them information

scream.英释: a loud high sound that you make with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

sorrow.中释: 悲痛， 悲哀， 悲伤； 伤心事， 不幸的事
sorrow.英释: a feeling of great sadness, usually because someone has died or because something terrible has happened to you

invent.中释: 发明， 创造； 捏造
invent.英释: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

fluent.英释: able to speak a language very well

pillar.英释: a tall upright round post used as a support for a roof or bridge

outset.英释: at or from the beginning of an event or process

global.中释: 全球的， 全世界的； 总的， 完整的
global.英释: affecting or including the whole world

unless.英释: used to say that something will happen or be true if something else does not happen or is not true

greedy.中释: 贪吃的； 贪婪的； 渴望的
greedy.英释: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

guitar.英释: a musical instrument usually with six strings that you play by pulling the strings with your fingers or with a  plectrum (= small piece of plastic, metal etc )

layout.中释: 布局， 安排， 设计
layout.英释: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

revolt.英释: strong and often violent action by a lot of people against their ruler or government

relate.英释: if two things relate, they are connected in some way

cattle.英释: cows and  bull s  kept on a farm for their meat or milk

verify.中释: 证实， 查证， 证明
verify.英释: to state that something is true

coupon.中释: 礼券， 优惠券， 配给券； 联票； 票证
coupon.英释: a small piece of printed paper that gives you the right to pay less for something or get something free

agenda.英释: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

liquid.英释: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk

sleeve.英释: the part of a piece of clothing that covers all or part of your arm

coarse.中释: 粗的， 粗糙的； 粗劣的； 粗俗的
coarse.英释: having a rough surface that feels slightly hard

nephew.英释: the son of your brother or sister, or the son of your husband’s or wife’s brother or sister

depart.中释: 离开， 起程， 出发
depart.英释: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

thrust.中释: 戳， 刺； 要点， 要旨； 推力
thrust.英释: the main meaning or aim of what someone is saying or doing

insure.英释: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

powder.英释: a dry substance in the form of very small grains

temple.中释: 圣堂， 神殿， 庙宇
temple.英释: a building where people go to  worship  , in the Jewish, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Mormon religions

growth.中释: 增长， 增长量； 生长， 生长物
growth.英释: an increase in the value of goods or services produced and sold by a business or a country

carrot.英释: a long pointed orange vegetable that grows under the ground

famine.英释: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die

visual.英释: something such as a picture or the part of a film, video etc that you can see, as opposed to the parts that you hear

empire.英释: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

fairly.中释: 相当， 尚可， 还； 公平地
fairly.英释: more than a little, but much less than very

packet.英释: a small flat package that is sent by post or delivered to someone

aboard.英释: on or onto a ship, plane, or train

throat.中释: 咽喉， 喉咙； 嗓音
throat.英释: the passage from the back of your mouth to the top of the tubes that go down to your lungs and stomach

manual.英释: a book that gives instructions about how to do something, especially how to use a machine

retire.中释: 退休， 退役； 退下， 退出， 撤退； 就寝
retire.英释: to go away to a quiet place

aspect.中释: 方面； 朝向， 方向； 样子， 外表
aspect.英释: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

oblige.中释: 迫使； 施恩于， 帮…的忙； 使感激
oblige.英释: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

saddle.中释: 给…装鞍； 使承担任务
saddle.英释: to put a saddle on a horse

female.英释: an animal that belongs to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs

volume.中释: 卷， 册， 书卷； 容积， 体积； 音量， 响度
volume.英释: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

bullet.中释: 枪弹， 子弹， 弹丸
bullet.英释: a small piece of metal that you fire from a gun

modify.中释: 更改， 修改； 修饰
modify.英释: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

career.中释: 生涯， 职业， 经历
career.英释: a job or profession that you have been trained for, and which you do for a long period of your life

faulty.中释: 有错误的， 有缺点的
faulty.英释: not working properly, or not made correctly

defect.中释: 缺点， 缺陷， 欠缺
defect.英释: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect

anyhow.中释: 无论如何， 不管怎么说； 随随便便地， 杂乱无章地
anyhow.英释: in a careless or untidy way

script.中释: 剧本， 广播稿； 书写用的字母； 笔迹， 手迹

system.中释: 系统； 制度， 体制； 方法， 做法； 身体
system.英释: a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose

roller.英释: a piece of equipment consisting of a tube-shaped piece of wood, metal etc that rolls over and over, used for painting, crushing, making things smoother etc

remind.英释: to make someone remember something that they must do

vacuum.英释: a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

bubble.英释: a ball of air or gas in liquid

tender.英释: a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

anchor.英释: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving

insect.英释: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

border.中释: 给…加上边， 围； 邻接； 与…接壤
border.英释: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it

estate.中释: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
estate.英释: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

rumour.英释: information or a story that is passed from one person to another and which may or may not be true

favour.中释: 赞同； 喜爱， 偏爱； 有利于
favour.英释: to provide suitable conditions for something to happen

harden.英释: to become firm or stiff, or to make something firm or stiff

abroad.中释: 到国外； 在传播， 在流传
abroad.英释: in or to a foreign country

drawer.英释: part of a piece of furniture, such as a desk, that you pull out and push in and use to keep things in

resort.中释: 求助， 凭借， 诉诸； 求助的对象， 采用的手段； 常去之地， 胜地
resort.英释: a place where a lot of people go for holidays

remain.中释: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
remain.英释: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

atomic.中释: 原子的， 原子能的， 原子武器的
atomic.英释: relating to the energy produced by splitting atoms or the weapons that use this energy

rotten.中释: 腐烂的； 令人不愉快的； 糟糕的
rotten.英释: badly decayed and no longer good to use

accuse.英释: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

notion.中释: 概念， 观念； 意图， 想法， 念头

horror.中释: 恐怖； 憎恶； 令人恐怖的事物
horror.英释: something that is very terrible, shocking, or frightening

arouse.中释: 引起； 唤起， 唤醒

boring.中释: 令人厌烦的， 乏味的， 无聊的

metric.英释: using or connected with the  metric system  of weights and measures

debate.英释: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions

stripe.英释: a line of colour, especially one of several lines of colour all close together

museum.英释: a building where important  cultural  , historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

senate.英释: the smaller and more important of the two parts of the government with the power to make laws, in countries such as the US, Australia, and France

string.中释: 缚，扎，挂；串起，穿；使排成一列；伸展，拉直
string.英释: to put things together onto a thread, chain etc

occupy.英释: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

summit.中释: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
summit.英释: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

typist.英释: a secretary whose main job is to  type  letters

factor.中释: 因素； 因子； 系数
factor.英释: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

target.英释: to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

leader.中释: 领袖， 领导人， 首领
leader.英释: the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc

bounce.英释: the action of moving up and down on a surface

tissue.中释: 组织； 薄绢， 薄纸， 手巾纸
tissue.英释: a piece of soft thin paper, used especially for blowing your nose on

loosen.中释: 解开； 放松， 松弛
loosen.英释: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened

modest.中释: 谦虚的； 适中的； 羞怯的
modest.英释: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

hatred.中释: 憎恶， 憎恨， 仇恨
hatred.英释: an angry feeling of extreme dislike for someone or something

violet.英释: a plant with small dark purple flowers, or sometimes white or yellow ones

hollow.中释: 空的， 空洞的； 沉闷的； 虚伪的

saving.中释: 节省， 节约； 储蓄金， 存款
saving.英释: all the money that you have saved, especially in a bank

jungle.中释: 丛林， 密林， 莽丛； 乱七八糟的一堆
jungle.英释: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

settle.中释: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
settle.英释: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

scrape.英释: a mark or slight injury caused by rubbing against a rough surface

talent.中释: 天才， 才能； 人才
talent.英释: a natural ability to do something well

violin.英释: a small wooden musical instrument that you hold under your chin and play by pulling a bow(= special stick ) across the strings

market.中释: 市场； 股市； 行情， 销路
market.英释: a particular country or area where a company sells its goods or where a particular type of goods is sold

cruise.英释: A cruise is a holiday during which you travel on a ship or boat and visit a number of places

solemn.中释: 庄严的， 隆重的； 严肃的
solemn.英释: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

insert.中释: 插入， 嵌入； 登载
insert.英释: to put something inside or into something else

remark.中释: 话语； 谈论， 评论
remark.英释: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed

forbid.中释: 禁止， 不许， 阻止
forbid.英释: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

profit.英释: to be useful or helpful to someone

differ.中释: 不同， 相异； 发生分歧
differ.英释: if two people or groups differ about something, they have opposite opinions

latter.英释: being the second of two people or things, or the last in a list just mentioned

extent.中释: 广度； 范围； 程度
extent.英释: used to say how true something is or how great an effect or change is

outlet.中释: 出口， 出路； 发泄途径
outlet.英释: a way of expressing or getting rid of strong feelings

shrink.中释: 起皱； 收缩； 退缩， 畏缩
shrink.英释: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

former.英释: the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

extend.中释: 延长， 扩大； 提供， 给予； 伸展， 达到
extend.英释: to continue for a particular distance or over a particular area

scheme.英释: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

affect.英释: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

sailor.英释: someone who works on a ship

inward.英释: felt or experienced in your own mind but not expressed to other people

charge.中释: 费用； 管理； 控告， 指责； 电荷， 充电
charge.英释: the amount of money you have to pay for goods or services

sample.中释: 从…抽样； 品尝， 体验
sample.英释: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like

plunge.中释: 纵身投入， 猛冲； 猛跌
plunge.英释: If something or someone plunges in a particular direction, especially into water, they fall, rush, or throw themselves in that direction

spider.英释: a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads

utmost.英释: the most that can be done

ribbon.中释: 缎带， 丝带； 色带
ribbon.英释: a narrow piece of attractive cloth that you use, for example, to tie your hair or hold things together

adjust.中释: 调整， 调节， 校正
adjust.英释: to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

parade.英释: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street

rhythm.英释: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

stroke.英释: to move your hand gently over something

tunnel.英释: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

select.英释: to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

output.英释: if a computer outputs information, it produces it

vessel.中释: 容器； 船； 飞船； 管

likely.英释: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true

digest.英释: a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc

urgent.英释: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

belief.中释: 信任， 相信； 信念
belief.英释: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

bundle.中释: 收集， 归拢； 把…塞入
bundle.英释: If someone is bundled somewhere, someone pushes them there in a rough and hurried way

fasten.英释: to firmly close a window, gate etc so that it will not open, or to become firmly closed

author.英释: someone who has written a book

hammer.英释: the part of a gun that hits the explosive charge that fires a bullet

mental.中释: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
mental.英释: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

racial.英释: relating to the relationships between different races of people who now live in the same country or area

highly.中释: 高度地， 极， 非常赞许地

nature.中释: 大自然； 本性； 性质
nature.英释: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

social.中释: 社会的； 交际的， 社交的
social.英释: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives

luxury.英释: very great comfort and pleasure, such as you get from expensive food, beautiful houses, cars etc

county.英释: an area of a state or country that has its own government to deal with local matters

injury.中释: 损害， 伤害； 受伤处
injury.英释: a wound or damage to part of your body caused by an accident or attack

wander.中释: 漫游， 闲逛， 漫步； 偏离正道； 走神， 恍惚
wander.英释: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

oppose.英释: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

copper.中释: 铜； 铜币， 铜制器
copper.英释: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu

pierce.英释: If a sharp object pierces something, or if you pierce something with a sharp object, the object goes into it and makes a hole in it

single.英释: a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again

cement.中释: 黏结； 巩固， 使团结
cement.英释: to make a relationship between people, countries, or organizations firm and strong

subway.英释: a railway system that runs under the ground below a big city

gallon.英释: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to eight pints. In Britain this is 4.55 litres, and in the US it is 3.79 litres.

assist.中释: 援助， 帮助， 协助
assist.英释: to help someone to do something

sector.中释: 部门， 部分； 防御地段， 防区； 扇形
sector.英释: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

carpet.英释: heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

region.中释: 地区， 地带， 区域； 范围， 幅度
region.英释: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

yearly.英释: happening or appearing every year or once a year

saucer.英释: a small round plate that curves up at the edges, that you put a cup on

donkey.英释: a grey or brown animal like a horse, but smaller and with long ears

virtue.中释: 善， 美德； 优点， 长处
virtue.英释: moral goodness of character and behaviour

normal.中释: 正常的， 平常的； 正规的， 规范的

slight.英释: to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

dragon.英释: a large imaginary animal that has wings and a long tail and can breathe out fire

beyond.中释: 在…的那边，远于；迟于；越出
beyond.英释: on or to the further side of something

timber.中释: 木材， 原木； 大木料， 栋木
timber.英释: wood used for building or making things

fabric.中释: 织物， 纺织品； 结构
fabric.英释: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

indoor.英释: used or happening inside a building

sexual.中释: 性的， 两性的； 性别的
sexual.英释: relating to the physical activity of sex

recall.中释: 回忆； 召回， 叫回； 收回， 撤销
recall.英释: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

barber.英释: a man whose job is to cut men’s hair and sometimes to  shave  them

filter.英释: something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

scarce.中释: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
scarce.英释: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

create.中释: 创造； 引起， 产生
create.英释: to make something exist that did not exist before

ending.中释: 结尾， 结局； 死亡
ending.英释: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes

motion.中释: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
motion.英释: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

accent.中释: 口音， 腔调； 重音
accent.英释: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from

treaty.中释: 条约， 协议， 协定
treaty.英释: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

refuse.英释: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do

mirror.英释: if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

belong.英释: If something belongs to you, you own it

direct.英释: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

public.英释: ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

palace.英释: the official home of a person of very high rank, especially a king or queen – often used in names

living.英释: the way that you earn money or the money that you earn

animal.英释: human feelings, desires etc that are connected with sex, food, and other basic needs

custom.英释: something that is done by people in a particular society because it is traditional

employ.英释: to pay someone to work for you

freeze.英释: if a liquid or something wet freezes or is frozen, it becomes hard and solid because the temperature is very cold

notice.英释: when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

meadow.英释: a field with wild grass and flowers

master.英释: someone who is very skilled at something

double.英释: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

repair.英释: something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

broken.英释: in small pieces because it has been hit, dropped etc

become.英释: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something

prison.英释: a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime, or while they are waiting to go to court for their  trial

length.英释: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

forget.英释: to not remember facts, information, or people or things from the past

appear.英释: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

dollar.中释: 元〔美国、加拿大、澳大利亚等国的货币单位〕
dollar.英释: the standard unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia, and some other countries, divided into 100  cent s  : symbol $

answer.英释: to say something to someone as a reply when they have asked you a question, made a suggestion etc

basket.英释: a container made of thin pieces of plastic, wire, or wood woven together, used to carry things or put things in

spring.英释: a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

ladder.英释: a piece of equipment used for climbing up to or down from high places. A ladder has two bars that are connected by rungs

course.英释: a series of lessons in a particular subject

native.英释: someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

person.英释: a human being, especially considered as someone with their own particular character

clever.英释: able to learn and understand things quickly

orphan.英释: a child whose parents are both dead

really.英释: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think

hunger.英释: the feeling that you need to eat

cheque.英释: a printed piece of paper that you write an amount of money on, sign, and use instead of money to pay for things

centre.英释: to move something to a position at the centre of something else

itself.英释: used to show that a thing, organization, animal, or baby that does something is affected by its own action

amount.英释: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

number.英释: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity

league.英释: a group of sports teams or players who play games against each other to see who is best

prince.英释: the son of a king, queen, or prince

recent.英释: having happened or started only a short time ago

simply.英释: if you say or explain something simply, you say it in a way that is easy for people to understand

cotton.英释: cloth or thread made from the white hair of the cotton plant

eighth.英释: one of eight equal parts of something

lumber.英释: pieces of wood used for building, that have been cut to specific lengths and widths

freely.英释: without anyone stopping or limiting something

permit.英释: an official written statement giving you the right to do something

artist.英释: someone who produces art, especially paintings or drawings

reader.英释: someone who reads books, or who reads in a particular way

coffee.英释: a hot dark brown drink that has a slightly bitter taste

nearly.英释: almost, but not quite or not completely

lawyer.英释: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

deceit.英释: behaviour that is intended to make someone believe something that is not true

choose.英释: to decide which one of a number of things or people you want

bruise.英释: a purple or brown mark on your skin that you get because you have fallen, been hit etc

record.英释: to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future

excuse.英释: a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

cellar.英释: a room under a house or other building, often used for storing things

dinner.英释: the main meal of the day, eaten in the middle of the day or the evening

bottle.英释: a container with a narrow top for keeping liquids in, usually made of plastic or glass

monkey.英释: a small brown animal with a long tail, which uses its hands to climb trees and lives in hot countries

indeed.英释: used to emphasize a statement or answer

silent.英释: without any sound, or not making any sound

income.英释: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

method.英释: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

modern.英释: belonging to the present time or most recent time

common.英释: happening often and to many people or in many places

castle.英释: a very large strong building, built in the past as a safe place that could be easily defended against attack

partly.英释: to some degree, but not completely

escape.英释: the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

golden.英释: having a bright yellow colour like gold

family.英释: a group of people who are related to each other, especially a mother, a father, and their children

pretty.英释: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

reason.英释: to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

canvas.英释: strong cloth used to make bags, tents, shoes etc

office.英释: a building that belongs to a company or organization, with rooms where people can work at desks

afraid.英释: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen

cinema.英释: a building in which films are shown

clothe.英释: to put clothes on your body

please.英释: to make someone happy or satisfied

beside.英释: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

prefer.英释: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

church.英释: a building where Christians go to worship

gather.英释: to come together and form a group, or to make people do this

midday.英释: the middle of the day, at or around 12 o’clock

needle.英释: a small thin piece of steel, with a point at one end and a hole in the other, used for sewing

finger.英释: one of the four long thin parts on your hand, not including your thumb

myself.英释: used by the person speaking or writing to show that they are affected by their own action

police.英释: the people who work for an official organization whose job is to catch criminals and make sure that people obey the law

cheese.英释: a solid food made from milk, which is usually yellow or white in colour, and can be soft or hard

decide.英释: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

rabbit.英释: a small animal with long ears and soft fur, that lives in a hole in the ground

energy.英释: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

shriek.英释: a loud high sound made because you are frightened, excited, angry etc

betray.英释: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

August.英释: the eighth month of the year, between July and September

during.英释: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

marble.英释: a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,  statue s  etc

period.英释: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end

lively.英释: full of life and energy; active and enthusiastic

report.英释: to tell someone about what has been happening, or what you are doing as part of your job

hasten.英释: to make sth happen sooner or more quickly

mutter.英释: to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you

flight.英释: a journey in a plane or space vehicle, or the plane or vehicle that is making the journey

bridge.英释: a structure built over a river, road etc that allows people or vehicles to cross from one side to the other

anyone.英释: used to refer to any person, when it is not important to say exactly who

driver.英释: someone who drives a car, bus etc

chance.英释: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do

grieve.英释: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died

brandy.英释: a strong alcoholic drink made from wine, or a glass of this drink

camera.英释: a piece of equipment used to take photographs or make films or television programmes

button.英释: to fasten clothes with buttons, or to be fastened with buttons

Friday.英释: the day between Thursday and Saturday

pardon.英释: to forgive someone for behaving badly

phrase.英释: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

minute.英释: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

Africa.英释: the second largest continent; located south of Europe and bordered to the west by the South Atlantic and to the east by the Indian Ocean

radius.英释: the distance from the centre to the edge of a circle, or a line drawn from the centre to the edge

farmer.英释: someone who owns or manages a farm

honour.英释: something that makes you feel very proud

plenty.英释: a large quantity that is enough or more than enough

friend.英释: someone who you know and like very much and enjoy spending time with

toilet.英释: a room or building containing a toilet

gentle.英释: kind and careful in the way you behave or do things, so that you do not hurt or damage anyone or anything

change.英释: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

voyage.英释: to travel to a place, especially by ship

fourth.英释: ¼; one of four equal parts

branch.英释: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

sulfur.英释: (sulphur)a common light yellow chemical substance that burns with a very strong unpleasant smell, and is used in drugs, explosives, and industry. It is a chemical element :symbol S

pocket.英释: small enough to be carried in your pocket

borrow.英释: to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later

dialog.英释: a conversation in a book, play, or film

garden.英释: piece of land next to or around your house where you can grow flowers, fruit, vegetables, etc., usually with an area of grass(called a lawn )

health.英释: the general condition of your body and how healthy you are

flower.英释: a coloured or white part that a plant or tree produces before fruit or seeds

breath.英释: the air that you take into your lungs and send out again

invite.英释: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc

almost.英释: nearly, but not completely or not quite

punish.英释: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

island.英释: a piece of land completely surrounded by water

excite.英释: to make someone feel happy, interested, or eager

silver.英释: a valuable shiny, light grey metal that is used to make jewellery, knives, coins etc. It is a chemical element : symbol Ag

defend.英释: to do something in order to protect someone or something from being attacked

always.英释: all the time, at all times, or every time

follow.英释: to go, walk, drive etc behind or after someone else

ground.英释: the solid surface of the earth

Canada.英释: a nation in northern North America

advise.英释: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

finish.英释: the end or last part of something

cousin.英释: the child of your uncle or aunt

affair.英释: public or political events and activities

except.英释: used to introduce the only person, thing, action, fact, or situation about which a statement is not true

depend.英释: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc

Monday.英释: the day between Sunday and Tuesday

danger.英释: the possibility that someone or something will be harmed, destroyed, or killed

coward.英释: someone who is not at all brave

honest.英释: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

orange.英释: a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside

fridge.英释: a large piece of electrical kitchen equipment, used for keeping food and drinks cool

famous.英释: known about by many people in many places

mother.英释: a female parent of a child or animal

doctor.英释: someone who is trained to treat people who are ill

waggon.英释: (wagon)a strong vehicle with four wheels, used for carrying heavy loads and usually pulled by horses

regret.英释: sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

memory.英释: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

accept.英释: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

behind.英释: at or towards the back of a thing or person

polite.英释: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

square.英释: a shape with four straight equal sides with 90˚ angles at the corners

banana.英释: a long curved tropical fruit with a yellow skin

collar.英释: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over

forest.英释: a large area of land that is covered with trees

member.英释: a person or country that belongs to a group or organization

corner.英释: the point at which two lines or edges meet

mainly.英释: used to mention the main part or cause of something, the main reason for something etc

Mister.英释: Men are sometimes addressed as mister, especially by children and especially when the person talking to them does not know their name

damage.英释: physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

bitter.英释: making you feel very unhappy and upset

helmet.英释: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

adverb.英释: a word that adds to the meaning of a verb, an adjective, another adverb, or a whole sentence, such as ‘slowly’ in ‘He ran slowly’, ‘very’ in ‘It’s very hot’, or ‘naturally’ in ‘Naturally, we want you to come.’

potato.英释: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

rotary.英释: turning in a circle around a fixed point, like a wheel

arrive.英释: to get to the place you are going to

parent.英释: the father or mother of a person or animal

letter.英释: a written or printed message that is usually put in an envelope and sent by mail

ampere.英释: a unit used for measuring electric current

manage.中释: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
manage.英释: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

candle.英释: a stick of  wax  with a string through the middle, which you burn to give light

nation.英释: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

repeat.英释: an event that is very like something that happened before

joyful.英释: very happy, or likely to make people very happy

expect.英释: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

daring.英释: involving a lot of risk or danger, or brave enough to do risky things

bronze.英释: a hard metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  tin

inside.英释: the inner part of something, which is surrounded or hidden by the outer part

deduce.英释: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

lonely.英释: unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to

choice.英释: an act of choosing between two or more possibilities; something that you can choose

storey.英释: a floor or level of a building

beauty.英释: a quality that people, places, or things have that makes them very attractive to look at

regard.英释: to think about someone or something in a particular way

height.英释: how tall someone or something is

mortal.英释: not able to live for ever

pencil.英释: an instrument that you use for writing or drawing, consisting of a wooden stick with a thin piece of a black or coloured substance in the middle

bright.英释: shining strongly, or with plenty of light

heaven.英释: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

Europe.英释: the continent that is north of the Mediterranean and goes as far east as the Ural Mountains in Russia

actual.英释: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

plough.英释: to turn over the earth using a plough so that seeds can be planted

either.英释: one or the other of two; it does not matter which

mostly.英释: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc

player.英释: a person who takes part in a game or sport

better.英释: to a higher standard or quality

cherry.英释: a small round red or black fruit with a long thin stem and a stone in the middle

cannon.英释: a large heavy powerful gun that was used in the past to fire heavy metal balls

people.英释: used as the plural of ‘person’ to refer to men, women, and children

around.英释: surrounding or on all sides of something or someone

thread.英释: a long thin string of cotton, silk etc used to sew or weave cloth

across.英释: from one side to the other side of sth

attend.英释: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

cloudy.英释: a cloudy sky, day etc is dark because there are a lot of clouds

listen.英释: to pay attention to what someone is saying or to a sound that you can hear

lesson.英释: a period of time in which someone is taught a particular skill, for example how to play a musical instrument or drive a car

butter.英释: a soft yellow food made from cream or milk, used in cooking and for spreading on bread

middle.英释: half of the way through an event or period of time

autumn.英释: the season between summer and winter, when leaves change colour and the weather becomes cooler
